description: Construction of 3 storey residential building with basement to provide 7no self-contained flats (6x two bedroom and 1x one-bedroom); provision of refuse and recycling store, cycle parking and landscaping
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details and retain thereafter. Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with the objectives of policies 4.1, 4.8 and 5.5 of the Council's Adopted Uniary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004 | Prior to the commencement of any works on site, a contaminated land investigation shall be carried out, using sampling points and methods agreed with the Local Planning Authority and subsequently a risk assessment shall be prepared, following the CLEA guidance.  A scheme shall then be submitted for approval to describe the proposed methods of removal, neutralising or sealing of the contamination, and for the remedial works to be implemented before any other works commence.     Reason: To protect health and safety and prevent pollution of the water environment, in accordance with policy 2.7 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004. | The development will be affected by, aircraft noise at a level which falls into Category [B] noise exposure and also building services noise.  Prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for mitigation works to protect sensitive rooms, gardens and balconies from external noise. The criteria to be met and the assessment method shall be that specified in the Environmental Health's Department Document 5.3 "Guidance for developers".  The details shall also include alternative means of ventilation for noise sensitive rooms, meeting the said criteria. The works, as approved, shall be completed before occupation and thereafter permanently retained. Reason:  To protect the occupiers of the new dwellings against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with UDP policies 4.11 and 5.5 and Supplementary Planning Guidence 10 (Noise and Vibration) | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted drawings, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, including a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment (including separation of the amenity space areas) to be erected. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and shall be completed prior to first occupation and permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To protect the character and appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8: Safer Ealing. | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscape works for the development including any replacement tree planting have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local  Planning Authority, and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to first occupation of dwelling hereby approved, or in accordance with a  programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season. Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the character and appearance of the locality, in accordance with policies 4.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding any indications on drawing no.L01 rev B, prior to commencement of works, details of secure and weatherproof cycle parking shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The approved facilities shall be provided prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and shall be permanently retained.  Reason: To ensure that adequate cycle parking and associated facilities are available within the site in accordance with Adopted UDP policy 9.6. | Details of a programme of archaeological work in accordance with a written scheme for investigation shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved. The approved archaeological works shall be carried out by a suitably qualified investigating body acceptable to the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To protect any archaeological remains on site, in accordance with policy 4.9 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, details of refuse and recycling storage shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) 4 'Refuse and Recycling Facilities'. | Prior to the first occupation of the development details of the materials and / or level of obscure glazing for the privacy screening to the balconies at first floor level shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure there adequate privacy would be maintained between the first floor units and to the neighbouring property at no. 8 in accordance with policy 5.5 of the adopted Unitary development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004 | The entire root system of all trees to be retained, including trees covered by Tree Protection Orders, shall be protected by stout exclusion fencing until completion of the development. Any proposal to alter or remove any the trees covered by a Tree Protection Order would require the submission of a separate planning application.  Reason: To prevent damage to the trees in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9: Trees and Development Guidelines | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes standards unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure access for all future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Any existing vehicle access to the site which would be made redundant by the development hereby approved shall be permanently closed before any part of the development is occupied or brought into use; and the footway shall be reinstated. Reason: In the interests of highway safety and the visual amenity of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 9.1 of Ealing's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
